choice.title: int array[10];
choice.tip: Correct. While declaring array you should mention the size of an array.

choice.title: int array;
choice.tip: Wrong.While declaring array you should mention the size of an array.

choice.title: array{10};
choice.tip: Wrong.The size of array must be enclosed with in the square brackets.

choice.title: int arr[] = new int[5]
choice.tip: Wrong.The correct answer is "int arr[] = new int[5]"

choice.title: int [] arr = new int[5]
choice.tip: Wrong.The correct answer is "int arr[] = new int[5]"

choice.title: Array elements can be of integer type only.
The rank of an Array is the total number of elements it can contain.
The default value of numeric array elements is zero.

choice.tip: Wrong, ar[0]and ar[1] will get the elements at poistion 1 and 2 of an array.
Wrong, ar[0]and ar[1] will get the elements at poistion 1 and 2 of an array.
Correct, ar[0]and ar[1] will get the elements at poistion 1 and 2 of an array.
